title: Search for type
content:
Hi, I am new to designing fonts and need some advice: First I would like to know where to find the font (to download for free, preferably) that is used to write “Harper’s Bazaar” and also “Vogue”, because I would like to base my design on that font.  
Then, is it a good way of designing to draw it on paper, then to scan it in, then to trace it in Illustrator and then to work with it further on Fontlab?  
Any feedback would be appreciated, thanks

 [‹ Trouble with Engravers Gothic!](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906230635/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35060 "Go to previous forum topic") [Florin ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906230635/http:/www.typophile.com/node/9913 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Tanya

comments.content:
ITS NOT HTF DIDOT, the small caps letters a and p and b and c are oval not round and balanced.  
its NOT any of the bodoni neither.

_...is it a good way of designing to draw it on paper, then to scan it in, then to trace it in Illustrator and then to work with it further on Fontlab?_

Many type designers do exactly that, Tanya, while others work directly on screen. Here is a recent post asking for [**type design how-tos**](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906230635/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35134).
